articles.title: Dallas Cowboys named most valuable sports franchise at $7.64 billion
articles.description: The Dallas Cowboys are the most valuable franchise in sports as Sportico estimates the NFL team is worth $7.64 billion.
articles.content:
Jerry Jones has said he would never sell the Dallas Cowboys. If he ever changed his mind, Sportico has it valued at $7.64 billion, making it the most valuable franchise across all sports.

articles.title: Ric Flair, 73, handles 'pressure,' authors classic performance in winning his final wrestling match
articles.description: Like only he could, Ric Flair, 73, authored his trademark strut and legendary "Woo!" chant, before winning the final wrestling match of a storied career -- a tag-team event -- in Nashville, Tennessee on Sunday night.

articles.title: Tony Finau wins Rocket Mortgage for second straight PGA Tour victory
articles.description: Tony Finau became the first PGA Tour player in three years to win consecutive regular-season events with his Rocket Mortgage Classic victory on Sunday.
articles.content:
DETROIT -- Tony Finau has changed the conversation about him in less than a calendar year.

articles.description: Bill Russell, the cornerstone of the Celtics dynasty that won eight straight titles and 11 overall during his career, died Sunday at age 88.
